alert.note: Alert for Mesa (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 23 at 12:38PM MDT until further notice by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory continues for the following rivers in Colorado... Gunnison River above Grand Junction affecting Mesa County. .Warm temperatures will continue to melt the snowpack and increase river flows. ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR SNOWMELT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding caused by rain and snowmelt continues. * WHERE...Gunnison River above Grand Junction. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 11.0 feet, water approaches the bottom of State Highway 141 bridge, as well as the base of the bridge near Redlands Dam. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:30 AM MDT Tuesday the stage was 10.4 feet. - Forecast...The river will oscillate just above bankfull through the weekend, with a maximum value of 10.8 feet late Friday evening. River levels are projected to lower below bankfull early next week. - Action stage is 10.0 feet. - Flood stage is 13.0 feet. - Http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: If you encounter a flooded roadway, turn around and find an alternative route. If you are in the advisory area, remain alert to possible flooding. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
